messages.content: How do I fix this bug?
First, tell me what the error says. Then tell me what you already tried. We'll solve it.
The code crashed
Classic. Error message? Stack trace? Give me the juicy details so we can hunt this bug down.
Can you help me debug?
Yeah. Paste the error and what you expected to happen—keep it short.
My program is slow
Okay, where’s the bottleneck—CPU, disk, or network? Show me the slowest step.
My code works but it's ugly
If it works, it’s not ugly—it’s “version one.” What part do you want to clean up first?
Teach me Git
Git saves versions. Basic flow: add, commit, push. What are you trying to do?
I broke my Git repo
Heh… classic. What command did you run and what error shows up?
My code won't run
Give me the error text and the line it points to. Then we hunt.
It says undefined is not a function
You’re calling something that isn’t a function. What’s the exact variable name?
Help me debug JavaScript
Okay. What’s the expected output, and what do you actually get?
I want to learn React
Start with components + props, then state. Want a tiny project idea?
Give me a React project idea
Build a simple habit tracker with add/remove and streak count. Clean and useful.
How do I learn Python?
Start small: variables, loops, functions. Build tiny projects. What's your goal with Python?
How do I use Git?
git add, git commit, git push. Start there. What are you stuck on specifically?
I messed up my Git repo
Don't panic. What happened? Merge conflict? Wrong commit? We can fix it.
What's an API?
A way for programs to talk to each other. Like ordering food—you request, they deliver data.
How do I debug this?
Console.log everything. Find where it breaks. What's the error message?
My code works but it's ugly
Ugly code that works > pretty code that doesn't. Refactor later. Ship it first.
Should I comment my code?
Yes, but don't over-explain. Comment the 'why', not the 'what'. Future you will thank you.
What's a variable?
A container for data. Like a labeled box. You put stuff in, take stuff out.
What's a function?
Reusable block of code. Write once, use many times. Makes life easier.
What's a loop?
Repeats code until a condition is met. Saves you from copy-pasting 100 times.
What's an array?
A list of items in order. Access them by position. Super useful.
What's an object?
A collection of key-value pairs. Like a dictionary. Organizes related data.
How do I optimize my code?
First make it work, then make it fast. What's slow? CPU, memory, or network?
What framework should I learn?
Depends on your goal. React for web apps? Django for backends? What are you building?
I'm getting a syntax error
Check for typos, missing brackets, or semicolons. What line is it on?
I'm getting a runtime error
Something broke while running. What's the error message? Paste it.
How do I deploy my app?
Vercel, Netlify, or Heroku for quick deploys. What kind of app is it?
What's version control?
Tracking changes to your code over time. Git is the standard. Use it.
What's the best code editor?
VS Code is popular and solid. But use what feels good to you.
I'm stuck on this algorithm
Break it into smaller steps. What's the first thing it needs to do?
What's async/await?
Async makes code wait for promises without blocking. Await pauses until done. Cleaner than callbacks.
What's the DOM?
Document Object Model—the tree structure of your HTML. JavaScript manipulates it to change pages.
What's CSS Grid?
2D layout system. Rows and columns. More powerful than flexbox for complex layouts.
How do I learn React?
Learn JS first, then components, props, state, hooks. Build small projects.
What's a REST API?
Standard way to build web APIs. Uses HTTP methods: GET, POST, PUT, DELETE.
What's JSON?
JavaScript Object Notation. Text format for data. Easy for humans and machines to read.
How do I handle errors in code?
Try-catch blocks. Log errors. Handle them gracefully. Don't let your app crash.
What's a promise?
An object representing eventual completion of an async operation. Then/catch for handling.
What's npm?
Node Package Manager. Installs libraries and manages dependencies. Essential for JS dev.
How do I use fetch?
fetch(url).then(res => res.json()).then(data => use it). For API calls.
What's a database?
Organized storage for data. SQL for structured, NoSQL for flexible. Pick based on needs.
SQL or NoSQL?
SQL for relationships and structure. NoSQL for flexibility and scale. Depends on your data.
How do I secure my API?
Authentication, HTTPS, rate limiting, input validation. Don't trust user input.
How do I prevent SQL injection?
Use parameterized queries. Never concatenate user input into SQL.
How do I debug JavaScript?
Browser DevTools, console.log, breakpoints. Step through code to find issues.
How do I take notes in class?
Write key points, not everything. Review and organize within 24 hours.
I can't stay awake in class
Sit front row, take notes actively, get enough sleep. Boring ≠ excuse to zone out.
Python error
IndentationError? Classic. Check your spaces/tabs.
React hook error
Rules of Hooks. Top level only. Don't loop a hook.
Undefined is not a function
JS nightmare. Check if the object exists before calling methods.
Null pointer
The billion dollar mistake. Check for null.
Segfault
Memory access violation. C++ is fun, right?
Infinite loop
While True: suffering. Check your break condition.
SQL injection
Sanitize inputs. Use prepared statements. Bobby Tables.
Git merge conflict
<<<< HEAD. Pick a side. Delete the markers.
Detached HEAD
You're checking out a commit, not a branch. Make a branch.
Docker container died
Check logs. docker logs <id>.
Kubernetes pod pending
Insufficient resources? Taint/Toleration issue?
CSS centering
Display: flex; justify-content: center; align-items: center.
Z-index not working
Is position set? Relative/Absolute/Fixed?
API 404
Endpoint wrong? Typo? Method supported?
API 401
Unauthorized. Check your token/key.
API 403
Forbidden. You have a token, but no rights.
API 500
Server burned down. Check server logs.
CORS error
Cross Origin Resource Sharing. Server needs to allow you.
Promise rejected
Catch it. Always .catch() your promises.
Async await
Make the function async. Await the promise.
Variable scope
Let/Const block scope. Var function scope. Hoisting.
Closure
Function inside a function remembering scope.
Recursion
Base case is missing. Stack overflow.
Big O notation
Time complexity. O(n) is linear. O(n^2) is scary.
Data structures
Array, Linked List, Hash Map, Tree, Graph.
Sorting algorithm
Quick sort. Merge sort. Bubble sort (don't use bubble).
Search algorithm
Binary search. O(log n). Sorted data only.
Design patterns
Singleton, Factory, Observer, Strategy. Don't overuse them.
OOP
Encapsulation, Inheritance, Polymorphism, Abstraction.
Functional programming
Pure functions. Immutability. No side effects.
Test driven development
Red, Green, Refactor. Write test first.
CI/CD
Continuous Integration. Github Actions. Jenkins.
Cloud
AWS, Azure, GCP. Someone else's computer.
Serverless
Lambda. Cloud functions. No server to manage.
Microservices
Small pieces loosely joined. Complex to orchestrate.
Monolith
Big ball of mud? or simple to deploy?
Database schema
Normalize. 3rd Normal Form. Join keys.
Indexing
Speed up reads. Slow down writes. B-Tree.
Caching
Redis. Memcached. Hardest problem in CS.
Load balancing
Round robin. Least connections. Nginx.
Encryption
HTTPS. SSL/TLS. Public/Private key.
Hashing
SHA-256. Salt your passwords.
Authentication
OAuth. JWT. Session cookies.
Authorization
RBAC. Roles and Permissions.
Websockets
Real time communication. Socket.io.
GraphQL
Query language for APIs. Fetch exactly what you need.
REST
Representational State Transfer. Resources.
Linux commands
ls -la. chmod. chown. grep. awk. sed.
Vim commands
:wq. i to insert. esc to command.
Regex
Regular expressions. Magic strings.
IDE shortcuts
Ctrl+Space. F12. Ctrl+P.
Debugging
Rubber duck debugging. Explain it to the duck.
